data.title: Japan’s Jan services PMI revised upward to 53; real wages rises for 2nd consecutive month
data.description:
Data showed that real wages in Japan rose for the second consecutive month in December, with nominal wage growth hitting a near three-decade high, driven by a surge in winter bonuses. Additionally, Japan’s services PMI for January was also revised upward to 53, from an initial reading of 52.7.

The au Jibun Bank Japan Services PMI was revised higher to 53.0 in January 2025, up from the preliminary reading of 52.7, after a final reading of 50.9 in the prior month, marking the third consecutive month of expansion in the service sector and the strongest pace since September.

The au Jibun Bank Japan Composite PMI stood at 51.1 in January 2025, in line with flash data and up from December's reading of 50.5.

Nominal wages in Japan rose 4.8% year-on-year in December 2024, up from 3.9% in November, exceeding market expectations of a 3.8% growth and marked the highest wage growth in nearly three decades. Inflation-adjusted real wages, which reflect consumer purchasing power, also increased by 0.6% in December, marking the second consecutive month of positive growth.

The Bank of Japan has emphasized the need for broad-based wage hikes to support higher borrowing costs. However, a labor ministry official noted, "Although monthly wages and base salaries are rising compared to the past, they are not keeping pace with prices."

The Nikkei 225 Index rose 0.3% to around 38,930 while the broader Topix Index added 0.8% to 2,760 on Wednesday, with Japanese shares rising for the second straight session. The Japanese yen strengthened past 154 per dollar on Wednesday, reaching a seven-week-high, as strong wage and services data bolstered expectations of a more hawkish stance from the Bank of Japan.

More on Japan

  • Japan’s core inflation rate surges to 16-month high of 3% in December

  • Bank of Japan raises policy rate to 0.5%, highest since 2008 amid sustained inflation and rising wages

  • Japan unexpectedly logs trade surplus, exports hits record high & imports also shows positive growth

  • BOJ's Dec summary raises expectations of rate hike soon; keeps policy rate steady at 0.25%

  • Japan’s Nov headline inflation rate rises to three-month high of 2.9%; core inflation tops forecast

data.title: Equinor raises dividend by 5.7% to $0.37 a share
data.description:
• Equinor (NYSE:EQNR) declares $0.37/share quarterly dividend, 5.7% increase from prior dividend of $0.35.
  • Forward yield 5.97%
  • Payable May 28; for shareholders of record May 16; ex-div May 16.
  • The company said that the proposed cash dividend is subject to approval by the annual general meeting of Equinor ASA on 14 May 2025.
  • The company raised its quarterly dividend by 5.7% after paying a quarterly dividend of $0.35 in each of the previous 4 quarters.
  • See EQNR Dividend Scorecard, Yield Chart, & Dividend Growth.

data.title: Equinor Non-GAAP EPS of $0.63, revenue of $27.65B beats by $1.94B; updates FY outlook
data.description:
• Equinor press release (NYSE:EQNR): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.63.
  • Revenue of $27.65B (-4.8% Y/Y) beats by $1.94B.
  • Proposed fourth quarter cash dividend of USD 0.37 per share and announced share buy-back of up to USD 5 billion for 2025.
  • The expected total capital distribution for 2025 of up to USD 9 billion. Stronger expected free cash flow, supporting sustained competitive capital distribution.
  • Equinor is well positioned for stronger cash flow and growth: Strategy to deliver competitive shareholder returns. Consistent value driven execution - expecting above 15% return on average capital employed* towards 2030.
  • Strengthening free cash flow, expecting USD 23 billion for 2025-2027 by reducing capex and addressing costs.
  • Increasing oil and gas production, expecting more than 10% growth from 2024-2027.
  • Reducing investment outlook to renewables and low carbon solutions to around USD 5 billion in total after project financing for 2025-2027.
  • Lowering expected capacity in renewables to 10-12 gigawatt by 2030.
  • Updated outlook for 2025: Organic capex expenditures* are estimated at USD 13 billion for 20252 . Oil & gas production for 2025 is estimated to grow 4% compared to 2024 level.

data.title: GH Research prices $150M stock offering
data.description:
• Clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company GH Research (NASDAQ:GHRS) priced of its previously announced underwritten public offering in the U.S. of 10M ordinary shares at a public offering price of $15.00 per share.
  • Total gross proceeds of ~$150M.
  • The offering is expected to close on February 6, 2025.
  • Underwriters have a 30-day option to purchase up to an additional 1.5M ordinary shares at the public offering price, less underwriting discounts and commissions.

data.description:
• Diversified Royalty Corp. (TSX:DIV:CA) declares CAD 0.0208/share monthly dividend, in line with previous.
  • Forward yield 6.26%

data.title: PennyMac Financial Services prices upsized offering of $850M senior notes
data.description:
• PennyMac Financial Services (NYSE:PFSI) and its subsidiaries priced its previously announced offering of $850M aggregate principal amount of 6.875% senior notes due 2033. T
  • he offering size was increased from the previously announced offering size of $650M aggregate principal amount of notes.
  • The notes will bear interest at 6.875% per annum and will mature on February 15, 2033.
  • Proceeds from the offering will be used for the repayment of certain of our indebtedness, which may include the repayment of borrowings under our secured MSR facilities and other secured indebtedness, for the repurchase or repayment of a portion of our 5.375% senior notes due October 2025, and for other general corporate purposes.
  • The offering is expected to close on February 6, 2025.

data.title: IDEX reports mixed Q4 results; initiates Q1 and FY25 outlook
data.description:
• IDEX press release (NYSE:IEX): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $2.04 beats by $0.01.
  • Revenue of $863M (+9.0% Y/Y) misses by $3.17M.
  • Operating cash flow of $173 million, down 14%, was 140% of net income, down from 185%.
  • Free cash flow of $157 million, down 12%, yielded conversion of 101% of adjusted net income, down from 129%.

  • 2025 Outlook:

    • Full year organic sales are projected to increase 1% to 3% over the prior year.
    • Full year GAAP diluted EPS of $6.56 to $6.96 (adjusted diluted EPS of $8.10 to $8.45 vs. consensus of $8.48).
    • First quarter 2025 organic sales are projected to decrease 3% to 4% from the prior year period.
    • First quarter GAAP diluted EPS of $1.18 to $1.24 (adjusted diluted EPS of $1.60 to $1.65 vs. consensus of $2.03).

data.title: CorVel GAAP EPS of $0.46, revenue of $228M
data.description:
• CorVel press release (NASDAQ:CRVL): Q3 GAAP EPS of $0.46.
  • Revenue of $228M (+12.9% Y/Y).
  • Exited the quarter with $163 million cash, cash equivalents, and no borrowings.
  • The Company repurchased $9.6 million of common stock during the quarter.

data.title: Callan JMB prices IPO at $4 per share
data.description:
• Integrative logistics company Callan JMB (CJMB) priced its initial public offering of 1.28M shares at an initial public offering price of $4.00 per share.
  • Gross proceeds are expected to be ~$5.12M.
  • Underwriters have a 45-day option to purchase, at the public offering price, up to an additional 192K shares.

  • The shares are expected to begin trading on the Nasdaq on February 5, 2025, under the ticker symbol “CJMB”.

  • The offering is expected to close on or about February 6, 2025.

  • The company intends to use the net proceeds primarily for sales support, marketing, customer expansion and general corporate purposes, including working capital.
